did.abstract: An 1894 letter adressed to the Honorable Levi P. Morton from Reverend Lyman Abbott urging the appointment of Benjamin Blair as Supreme Court Judge. Reverend Lyman Abbott was pastor of Plymouth Church and at the time of this letter, Morton was Governor-elect of the State of New York.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Xerxes Fine and Rare Books and Documents, 1986.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Reverend Lyman Abbott (1835-1922) was pastor of the Plymouth Church in Brooklyn from 1883 to 1899.
At the time of the letter, Levi P. Morton was Governor-elect of the State of New York.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Lyman Abbott letter, 1894, 1986.001; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A letter adressed to the Honorable Levi P. Morton of Columbia Heights, Brooklyn, from Reverend Lyman Abbott. Abbott urges the appointment of Benjamin Blair as Supreme Court Judge.
